fields.name: Montefalco Rosso DOC
fields.description: It pours a vibrant ruby red with aromas typical of the Montefalco soil: a fusion of balsamic and fruity notes ranging from cherry to currant, blackberry and plum. The mouthfeel is fresh with a balanced suite of tannins, and a rich perky flavour enlivens the fruity and balsamic tones. The wine is aged in large oak barrels for at least 12 months before bottling. Ideally matched with savoury dishes and mature cheeses.

fields.name: Montefalco Sagrantino Docg
fields.description: It pours a deep ruby red. Its powerful aroma of wild cherries, blackberries and plums develops notes of graphite, liquorice, juniper berries and aromatic herbs. The tannic weave, the freshness, the alcohol and sugar are well balanced. This wine to lay down is aged in casks for at least 2 years and in glass for 2 more, improving over time for at least 10 years. It accompanies strong mature cheeses, superior cured meats, grilled meats and game meat.

fields.name: Arquata Umbria Bianco Igt
fields.description: It pours a brilliant straw yellow colour. The initial aroma is of wild flowers and lavender, followed by notes of plum and apple. It is a full-bodied, freshly mineral and pleasantly fruity wine. Fermented and stored in stainless steel tanks, then fined in bottles for about 6 months. Ideal with appetizers, interesting with fish and white meat dishes.

fields.name: Montefalco Grechetto Doc
fields.description: It pours a strong straw yellow color. The aroma is elegant, marked by a delicate minerality enhanced by notes of peach, almond and hay. It is full-bodied and well-structured and holds a vivid acidity and an intense fruit-washed finish. As a young wine it is well-structured, balanced and mellow, yet holds interesting surprises after aging. It is fermented and stored in stainless steel tanks. It can accompany a wide variety of dishes: pulse and grain soups, superior cured meats, fresh or stretched curd cheeses and white meats. Interesting with pasta, grilled fish and shellfish.

fields.name: Amarone Della Valpantena
fields.description:
A modern Amarone, balanced and elegant, with fruity notes of cherries and blackberries, appealing spicy notes typical of the Valpantena. Soft, silky and creamy palate.
A full-bodied wine that requires pairing with rich dishes, mature cheeses and intense-ﬂavoured meat.

fields.name: Recioto della Valpantena DOCG
fields.description:
Dense and velvety, but never cloying; sweet, fragrant and intense with typical notes of cherry, which are enhanced by the ageing. The sugars are not high, leaving a lingering aftertaste of fruits of the forest, chocolate and liquorice.
It goes well with oven-baked cakes and fruit tarts; it makes an intriguing pairing with young and medium-matured cheeses.

fields.name: Soave DOC
fields.description:
This wine recalls the ﬂavour and style of wines in the 1930s, which have come back into fashion today. It is a wine with a rich nose, with notes of peach, pear, apricot and gooseberry. A sapid and mineral palate, but soft and lingering at the same time.
A white with great personality and complexity, it goes well with ﬂavoursome white meat dishes and intense-ﬂavoured ﬁsh dishes such as creamed dried cod.

fields.name: Attilio Brut
fields.description:
The ancient Nieddera variety, which is now a sparkling wine, has won a place in people’s hearts because it makes every day a celebration. 

Its bouquet is as subtle as a breath of spring air and as enjoyable as an unexpected flower. The bubbles sparkle in the glass and tickle the palate. This wine loves seafood but also appreciates white meat with light sauces and vegetable stews. But its favourite time of day is aperitif time.

fields.name: Tyrsos
fields.description:
This crisp wine delivers a pleasant salty
minerality followed by fruit flavours that linger
on the finish. 
Pair it with any starter or delicate seafood and
charcuterie.

fields.name: Mamaioa Bianco
fields.description:
This crisp wine delivers a pleasant salty
minerality followed by fruit flavours that linger
on the finish.
Pair it with any starter or delicate seafood
and charcuterie.

fields.name: I Giganti
fields.description:
This is a rich, structured wine with ample
freshness alongside a saline note. It will have
plenty of life in the cellar. 
Best with well-structured, rich, savoury dishes.
Perfect for seafood fregola topped with
bottarga roe shavings.

fields.name: Nebbiolo d'Alba DOC Roccheri
fields.description:
Nebbiolo is a very eclectic grape variety. It extracts many mineral nutrients from the hills made of limestone and clay soil which enrich its structure, while taking on fragrant and fruity aromas from soil rich in limestone and fine quartz sand. This union creates a complete, elegant wine whose ample bouquet is fruity and harmonious.

The wine reaches its peak condition between 2 and 8 years of age.

The color is ruby-red with garnet highlights. The bouquet has fruity notes reminiscent of wild berries and fragrant hints of violet and wild rose. A light, spicy vanilla note enhances the ample, complex bouquet further. The taste is intense but perfectly balanced and harmonious, with understated, docile tannins.

Thanks to its structure, it is an excellent accompaniment to tasty hors d'oeuvres, first courses with rich sauces, roasted or stewed meats. It is the ideal companion for cold cuts and mature cheeses.

fields.name: Roero Arneis DOCG
fields.description:
The grapes come from vineyards located on the steep hills of the Roero, characterized by predominantly calcareous-siliceous soils, particularly rich in quartz sand and fine clay mixed with thin, crumbly layers of sandstone. On these soft and permeable soils, which provide an abundance of trace elements while ensuring an immediate expression of the bouquet, the Arneis vine finds the ideal conditions for the expression of fresh and fragrant aromas.

The grapes are collected and quickly taken to the cellar where they are destemmed and delicately crushed to extract only the noblest and most aromatic parts of the skin and the outer area of the berry. The must is fermented in thermo-conditioned steel tanks at 20° C (68 F). Then the wine is stored in steel tanks or cement tanks lined with fiberglass to preserve its typical, fresh fragrance. The prolonged permanence on its own fermentation yeasts makes this wine long-lived and able to evolve even further once uncorked and poured in the glass.
The color is a pale straw-yellow and sometimes it has light antique-gold hues. The aroma is fruity with fragrant scents of acacia flowers, rennet apples, peaches and green hazelnuts. The taste is fresh, fragrant and lightly mineral.

It is traditionally served with delicate but intensely flavored appetizers such as veal in tuna sauce, flan, pasta with vegetables, rice salads, stewed, boiled or baked white meats. It is an ideal companion for raw or marinated fish.

fields.name: L' Intemporelle
fields.description: Ideal for buffet dinners, it adds a special touch of class to the most appetizing canapés. Perfect also for multi-course meals, it is particularly recommended in combination with roasted cutlets, grilled sea bass in a salt crust, turbot cooked to taste or risotto with white truffle.

fields.name: Asti Spumante
fields.description:
The grapes used to produce our Asti Spumante come from vineyards with extraordinary exposure and soil composition. The grapes are delicately crushed and the must is immediately refrigerated to prevent fermentation.
The must is stocked in temperature-controlled tanks at a temperature of -2° C (28° F) as it waits to be processed later (for the development of the foam).
The froth is persistent, the perlage fine and abundant, the color straw yellow with golden reflections. Aromatic scent, intense, tending to orange blossom. Sweet and lively taste reminiscent of olfactory sensations.

Being a sweet and aromatic sparkling wine, it is a classic dessert wine. It is a wonderful accompaniment to desserts on all festive occasions.

fields.name: Rosé de Mailly
fields.description:
Our ultimate aperitif champagne, the Rosé de Mailly, will add a touch of Maison Mailly charm to any cocktail party. On a summer terrace or in front of a warm fireplace in winter, the Rosé de Mailly is a must! Particularly recommended with tapas, iberian jamon, small feathered game, roast white meat or venison fillet with cranberries (incredibly good also with blue cheeses). For a sweeter note, try the Rosé de Mailly with a berries-based dessert or a charlotte of Biscuits Roses de Reims - simply a heavenly accompaniment.

Champagne rosé has always been a specialty of the House thanks to a terroir enriched by the ancient vineyards of Pinot Noir. Processed in a separate batch, this grape is harvested separately for a period of two days, then ordered on a triage table before destemming and light crushing - all under the watchful eye of the Master Winemaker.

fields.name: Blanc de Pinot Noir
fields.description: Since it was first presented more than 30 years ago, Mailly's Blanc de Pinot Noir has become a benchmark in a now highly sought after Champagne category. Our Champagne adds a special touch to any occasion: ideal as an aperitif, but also quite versatile as a match for an entire meal. Blanc de Pinot Noir distinguishes itself among all the single vineyard cuvées, it is the result of maximum precision to enhance its Grand Cru terroir in the best possible way.

fields.name: Brut Reserves
fields.description:
Mailly's Brut Réserve is the perfect aperitif - a must for an important lunch or a romantic Champagne dinner. Excellent choice for a cocktail party. A Champagne designed for convivial events, particularly suitable in combination with dishes such as pike-perch on a bed of leeks, creamy cheeses such as Chaource, apple pies and ice cream.

Fruit of wise precision and 100% grapes from Grand Cru alone, the Mailly Brut Reserve embodies the typical style of winemaking that distinguishes us, an essential element in a market that usually judges a Maison by the quality of its Champagne Brut NV.

fields.heading: Cantine Adanti is one of the historic cellars of the Montefalco area in Umbria, famous for its wines protected as Sagrantino and Montefalco Rosso.
fields.location:
Via Belvedere 2 – Loc. Arquata
06031 Bevagna – Perugia (Italy)
fields.content:
Cantine Adanti is one of the historic cellars of the Montefalco area in Umbria, famous for its wines protected as Sagrantino and Montefalco Rosso.

It covers about 40 hectares of land, of which 30 to vineyards and 10 to olive groves, located in the hilly areas of Arquata and Colcimino, famous since ancient times for its high quality of olive oil and wine.

The company was founded in the years 60s of the last century, when Domenico Adanti decides to buy the villa Arquata beginning the renovation of the old convent of the Friars Celestine, built on the ruins of the Roman period and then the late Renaissance, and performing at once the replanting of old vines and plant new ones.

fields.heading: The Bertani winery was founded in 1857 by the brothers Giovan Battista and Gaetano Bertani, in  Quinto di Valpantena, north of Verona.
fields.content:
With over 200 hectares of vineyards in the most suitable areas of the Verona province, today Bertani is a solid winery with a constantly increasing distribution in Europe and the rest of the world. There are two historic wineries, one in Grezzana, the current base and pulsing heart of the company, where vinification, bottling and shipment are carried out, and Tenuta Novare in Arbizzano di Negrar, in the heart of the Valpolicella Classica area, the cradle of great reds like Amarone and Valpolicella Classico Superiore.

As an icon of Italian wine in the world, Bertani combines typicity of native grape varieties with continuous improvement in the vineyards and attention to the terroir.

Respect for tradition is balanced by innovation and great business acumen in order to achieve the highest quality: these are the fundamental principles of the winery, today also the reference point for the great national group: Bertani Domains.

fields.heading: For 120 years, the Contini estate has been inspired by a single guiding principle, Vernaccia di Oristano.
fields.content:
First there was Salvatore, then Attilio, and today Paolo and his nephews, Alessandro and Mauro: the Contini winery has grown and aged, just like its wines, and enjoyed successes that have made it what it is today, thanks to the passion and commitment of no fewer than four generations.
Over the years, Vernaccia has been joined by other fine wines: the age-old Nieddera variety, traditional Vermentino and Cannonau wines, successful experiments like Karmis, the Attilio range, and the organic wine Mamaioa. Today the company produces a complete selection of wines which are sold throughout Italy and abroad. It is continuously evolving, introducing new winemaking techniques and ideas. Maybe that is why Contini wines stand the test of time, because they are loved and fondly remembered.

fields.heading: Marchesi di Barolo historical cellars are located in the town of Barolo, in the building overlooking the Castle of the Marquis Falletti.
fields.content:
Pietro Abbona, thanks to his skill and tenacity, together with his brother Ernesto and his sisters Marina and Celestina, was eventually able to acquire the ancient cellars of vinification and refinement of the Marchesi di Barolo estate from the Opera Pia Barolo.

Today the Abbona Family continues the work that began more than two centuries ago: producing high quality wines meant to enrich, year after year, the history of this important cellar where modernity and tradition meet and where a great heritage of vineyards and knowledge has been passed down from parents to children for over five generations.
